title: As a result of the tests you are taking, you are becoming more and more familiar with these ten valuable and expressive words. Now, as a further check on your learning, write the word that best fits each blank.

questions.question: outstandingly vicious; so bad as to be in a class by itself - "An ___ gambler"
Someone known the world over for criminal acts - "A ___ criminal"
An invading army kills, maims, and tortures without mercy, compunction, or regret. - "___ acts of cruelty"
The suspect answers the detective’s questions easily, fluently, almost too smoothly. - "___ responses"
A person reaches the acme of perfection as an actress or actor. - "A ___ performer"
No one can change someone’s absurdly romantic attitude toward life. - "An ___ romantic"
A mistake so bad that it defies description - "An ___ blunder"
Drunk almost all the time, again and again and again—periods of sobriety are few and very, very far between - "A ___ alcoholic"
Doctors find a persistent, dangerous infection in the bladder - "A ___ condition"
